title: Err boot USB Main Foxconn G31 ?!

forumNotes.author: Mr.Tran
forumNotes.content:
I use bootice make grub4dos usb boot, it good but with Main Foxconn G31 is not boot !  
Help me! Thank all!

forumNotes.content:
> I use bootice make grub4dos usb boot, it good but with Main Foxconn G31 is not boot ! > Help me! Thank all! This main***board*** ?: [http://www.foxconnch...id=en-us0000345](http://www.foxconnchannel.com/product/Motherboards/detail_overview.aspx?id=en-us0000345 "External link") * WHAT DEVICE does not boot? (internal hard disk, SATA or PATA, CD/DVD, external USB hard disk or memory stick, firewire, WHAT)? * WHAT do you mean "it doesn't boot"? (WHAT happens when you try booting the whatever you are trying to boot? DESCRIBE what you see)

:wink: Wonko

forumNotes.author: Mr.Tran
forumNotes.content:
Main Foxconn G31 is err no boot with usb use grub4dos.  
Please help!

forumNotes.author: ksanderash
forumNotes.content:
**Wonko** is right, you should give as much details as possible about the problem, if you want to get help quickly, and do not double post -- we see every new thread on the main forum page :wink:  

What USB Flash do you use? I had no-boot problem with Transcend JF600 on AMIBIOS Biostar G31, but solved it by correct formatting.  

You can try the following in Bootice 0.8.1:  
Reformat USB disk first, choose USB-HDD mode (63 or 2048 alignment, I use last)  
MBR -- UltraISO USB-HDD+ (should be set automaticaly, but check this)  
PBR -- GRUB for DOS  

Then copy on the UFD GRLDR and menu.lst that you have.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> **Wonko** is right
Yep :wink: , this is ***by definition*** :  
[http://idioms.yourdi...m/by-definition](http://idioms.yourdictionary.com/by-definition "External link")  

:wink:  

> You can try the following in Bootice 0.8.1:  
> Reformat USB disk first, choose USB-HDD mode (63 or 2048 alignment, I use last)
Just for the record, the 2048 alignment is NON-traditional and may fail, whilst the 63 one is the "traditional one" and is more likely to work on a wider number of systems.  

As well FAT16 is traditionally the most compatible filesystem.  

The alternative is using INSTEAD of BootICE, RMPREPUSB:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9460](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9460 "External link")  
[http://www.boot-land...;showtopic=7739](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?noref=1&showtopic=7739 "External link")  

IF RMPREPUSB also fails, you may want to try FBINST, that though being the "less-standard" app, has the WIDEST possible compatibility with ANY board:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9460](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9460 "External link")  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=7932](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7932 "External link")  

:wink:  
Wonko

Thank all!  
With bootice, i use MBR -- UltraISO USB-HDD+ (should be set automaticaly, but check this) PBR -- GRUB for DOS is Good  
or use FBINTS is good
